numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a fact about elite college admissions.
2. Some legacy applicants have parents with lower incomes.
3. Some non-legacy applicants have parents with much wealthier incomes.
4. A legacy applicant with lower-income parents has about the same probability of acceptance as a non-legacy applicant with wealthier-income parents.
5. I wonder why the x-axis is skewed.
6. I wonder how the skewed x-axis affects the data.
7. Legacy status has much sway in some elite colleges.
8. I wonder why legacy status has so much sway in these colleges.
9. This topic relates to me and to my community.
10. People around me apply to colleges frequently.
11. Several elite colleges are close to my community.
12. These colleges may make biased decisions now.
13. Financial income is a factor in some admissions decisions.
14. Legacy status is a factor in some admissions decisions.
15. I may apply to these colleges in the near future.
16. The headline is: How rigged the college admissions process actually is.
